text: we were on our way to Algeria to visit
family members there were more than a
hundred of us in a convoy of two
vehicles our truck broke down and it
took a whole day to fix in that time we
ran out of water we managed to find a
well but there was a very little water
one of us climbed down into the well and
managed to draw out a tiny amount but
the rest of us went thirsty the drivers
took us to wait while others went to
fetch water but a night and a day later
they had not returned that was when some
people started dying some 15 of us died
on that second day without water so we
moved on with the dead bodies in the
truck by this time the second vehicle
had returned with some water
alhamdulillah thanks to God for that we
came across some algerian security
forces but the drivers turned around
because they didn't want to be caught
carrying us since this was illegal so
they asked us to hide inside a trench we
spent another night there so that is
three nights in a row without any water
one woman started complaining and one of
the drivers used a hose to beat us many
women and children died the drivers had
some water in jerrycans but kept it just
for themselves from there they took us
back in Tunisia our water ran out again
there we were hungry and sitting amidst
corpses in the truck once we were in
Neesha the drivers removed the bodies
from the truck for burial they laid them
out on the ground mother's first then
their children on top of them those of
us who were still able to
mooove were told we will be taken back
to our village on the way we ran out of
petrol and they asked us to give them
money to buy more they told us to get
out of the truck while they went to get
the fuel they never came back we waited
for two days in the desert no food no
water before we decided to start walking
some vehicles passed us by we tried to
stop them but no one would stop one of
the passing cars even knocked down three
of our group and killed them there were
eight of us by now including my mom and
my younger sisters when we got tired
we sat under a tree and that was where
one of my sisters died we buried her
there then we continued walking and
after a day my second sister died then
on the third day my mother died I buried
all of them myself none of the vehicles
that passed us by agreed to stop and
pick me up after a while I found a tree
and sat under its shade almost giving up
at that point then a car came passing by
I took off my blouse and started waving
it wildly he stopped and asked me what
happened and I told him they gave me
some milk then water and rice cake I ate
a little but I couldn't continue then
they made me some tea it was only then
that we carried on traveling towards
outlet where I was reunited with my
grandfather so here I am
my father died long ago now my mother is
dead I have no sisters no brothers I'm
living with my aunt
I heard that only myself and a little
girl and 18 men survived the journey
out of more than 100 of us
